projects.title: EXPLRE - A directed Energy Mission to a nearby star system.
projects.description:
EX.PL.RE presents a directed energy interstellar mission to the Alpha Centauri system that pushes the boundaries of science and engineering, for the advancement of humankind and to inspire future generations to explore further.
The next frontier for humanity is beyond our solar system, embracing interstellar travel, to expand our knowledge of what is beyond our current scope of vision and understanding. This project outlines a mission to the Alpha Centauri system, our neighboring star system, as a technological proof of concept and scientific mission.
This mission will utilize directed energy technology to propel spacecraft for a journey of approximately 20 years. During the journey, the scientific payloads will conduct
groundbreaking research and upon reaching their destination, an assessment of the Alpha Centauri system to obtain a better understanding of the exoplanets in that system. This mission uses the ancient methods of travel and exploration, a sail and some wind, to find out what is beyond our scope of vision.

projects.title: Prediction of Future Microlensing events using Gaia eDR3
projects.description:
Gravitational microlensing is a highly effective & powerful tool in modern astronomy to study distant galaxies, detect extrasolar planets, black holes & quasars, and determine the mass of stellar objects. Therefore, predicting future microlensing events is essential to be observed at the exact moment they are happening to extract useful information. This paper aims to find future microlensing events using Gaia eDR3. A sample of 563,150 stars as potential lenses was obtained from 1.49 billion sources of Gaia eDR3, which satisfy: (1) Total proper motion>100mas/yr, (2) 
uncertainity>5 mas, (3) RUWE<2, (4) Gmag ≠ none. Then background sources were selected close to their paths. Finally, the future positions of lenses and sources were forecasted to determine epoch and angular separation at the closest approach. A final data sample of 120,172 was selected with lenses having a background source in the vicinity of 5 arcseconds. A nested interval algorithm was created with Python to obtain a list of future microlensing events between 2016 and 2076. Also, past microlensing events were predicted from 1996 to 2016. Finally, a graphical user interface was created to facilitate further prediction of these events and was published on GitHub to be publicly accessed.

projects.title: Analysis of MEMS based micro thruster using pyrotechnic propellant.
projects.description: A micro thruster was designed and was tested with two different pyrotechnic propellants BPN (Boron Potassium Nitrate) & ZPP (Zirconium Potassium Perchlorate) using computational methods on the software ANSYS.

projects.title: Solar Particle Event
projects.description:
The Sun, being the most massive star in our Solar System, produces a tremendous amount of energy due to the constant nuclear fusion reactions happening on its surface. The outermost layer of the solar atmosphere is called as, the Hot Solar Corona, which is expanding into Space. The Corona is the rim of the Sun which is visible to the naked eye. From the upper atmosphere of the sun, a stream of charged particles is released like a shockwave. Commonly known as Coronal Mass Ejection (CME).

What we aim to achieve, is to measure the density, by analyzing their characteristics, nature, and composition, of these shockwaves containing highly charged particles and how a huge amount of energy can be extracted from it. Our aim is to devise such a mechanism which extracts the energy from these high-intensity particles, store them and hence provides us with an alternate infinite power source.

projects.title: Study  and Fabrication  of  Centrifugal  Pump for  household  application
projects.description: We  emphasize  to  pay  our  attention  towards  the  study  of  the  most  common  household  application i.e.,  centrifugal  pump.  In  this  project,  we  aim  to  fabricate  a  centrifugal  pump  and  then  mapping  the  impeller  blade vane  profiles  w.r.t.  to  the  NACA  airfoil  series  in  order  to  increase  the  efficiency  of  the  pump.

projects.title: Blade  loss  analysis of  the  compressor  blade  of  gas  turbine  engine.
projects.description: Designing  the  basic  airfoil  shape  of  the  compressor  blade  and  then  making  a  3D  Cad  model  on CATIA  V5.  Analysis  of  the  rotational  stresses  using  ANSYS  solvers  and  after  optimizing  the  thermal  and  rotational stresses,  designing  the  complete  hub  assembly  of  the  blade  and  performing  blade  loss  analysis in  CFD solvers.

profile_positions.description:
AAC Clyde Space is a specialist in advanced and reliable subsystems for nanosatellites, CubeSats, small satellites and mission services. AAC provides turnkey and market leading New Space solutions and services for Government, commercial and educational organizations. 

Key Responsibilities include:

1. Development of business through sales, customer service and product development for ADCS subsystems, laser communications subsystems and various other components developed and designed at AAC Hyperion. 

2. Understanding various ADCS and laser communication subsystems offered by AAC Hyperion, on a technical level, and match them to client needs. 

3. Building strong relationships with internal engineering teams as well as customers. 

4. Evaluating incoming Requests for Proposals - mainly targeted at the subsystems from AAC Clyde Space's Dutch excellence center - trading off between Bid and NoBid decisions with the team, collaborating with different stakeholders to compile compelling technical, commercial and programmatic proposals to clients, enabling AAC Clyde Space technology to be baselined for future space missions as well as closing contracts.

5. Representing AAC Clyde Space - AAC Hyperion at international and national Space events.
profile_positions.title: Space Products Sales Manager

profile_positions.description:
BYJU's is the common brand name of Think & Learn in the B2C vertical. Having experience in Business Development, Client Relationship Management and Team building in Business to Customer Channel.

Key Responsibility Areas -

1. Filtering Leads, converting them into clients; demonstrating products/services for generating business in a demanding and fast-paced environment, thereby meeting competition.

2. Managing sales functions, build strong client relationships and provide high value-added services.

3. Customizing services as per the client's requirement for achieving optimum customer satisfaction levels.

4. Prioritize a daily workflow, including outbound calls, quotes and sales-related inquiries.
